Let D be the event of picking up a defected one from the remainings, G the good one.

\begin{aligned} &P(DGG) + P(G D G) + P(GG D) \\ &= \frac{5}{100} * \frac{95}{99} * \frac{94}{98} + \frac{95}{100} * \frac{5}{99} * \frac{94}{98} + \frac{95}{100} * \frac{94}{99} * \frac{5}{98} \\ &\approx 0.138 \end{aligned}
attr.q: In a factory there are 100 units of a certain product, 5 of which are defective. We pick three units from the 100 units at random. What is the probability that exactly one of them is defective?
